nodes.bodyText: This is not the same check as before. If pre-grouped symbols is a subset of the grouping keys, the old check would return true (!preGroupedSymbols.isEmpty()). In the new check, they have to match exactly the grouping keys.

This is not the same check as before.

The previous check was wrong. StreamingAggregationOperator is used when isStreamable() returns true. However, this means that preGrouped symbols might be subset of group-by symbols. StreamingAggregationOperator doesn't support that as it doesn't store any pages so it cannot group remaining symbols.
Luckly, the code in AddLocalExchanges.Rewriter#visitAggregation (which adds preGruoped symbols to AggregationNode) adds pre-grouped symbols field only when it matches groupingKeys so there was not hidden planning bug.
